EN

The provided text summarizes interviews from the FMLS:25 summit, featuring a discussion with Dor Eligula of BridgeWise on the rollout of AI in investment research. Eligula identifies 'blue ocean' growth opportunities for brokers in Asian markets and explains how local client behavior shapes demand. He provides examples of how AI automation works alongside human judgment to correct errors and enhance research quality. Additionally, the text mentions an interview with Brendan Callan, CEO of TRADU, who argues against the current Prop Trading model, citing issues such as excessive fee dependency, loose risk management, and confusion for retail investors.

Key Points

  • Dor Eligula discusses AI integration in investment research and growth potential in Asian markets.
  • The synergy between AI automation and human judgment is highlighted as crucial for error prevention.
  • Brendan Callan critiques the current Prop Trading model for its fee dependency and risk management issues.

Article
